name: Spicy Beef Hokkien Noodles
description: This recipe is made using my Homemade Chinese Stir Fry Sauce but I've also provided directions in Note 1 for how to make just enough sauce for this recipe. Use whatever veggies, meat and noodles you want!
recipeIngredient: 13oz / 400g   beef rump steak (, trimmed, thinly sliced)
2 tbsp chilli paste (, hot sauce, sriracha (to taste) OR finely chopped chilli)
Sliced red chilli (, sliced scallions/shallots and toasted sesame seeds)

recipeInstructions.text: Mix beef and 2 tbsp Stir-fry Sauce in a glass or ceramic bowl. Set aside for 20 minutes to marinate.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix beef and 2 tbsp Stir-fry Sauce in a glass or ceramic bowl. Set aside for 20 minutes to marinate.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 1/2 tbsp oil in a large wok over high heat. Cook beef for 1 1/2 minutes or until just cooked through. Transfer to a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1 1/2 tbsp oil in a large wok over high heat. Cook beef for 1 1/2 minutes or until just cooked through. Transfer to a bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 1/2 tbsp oil. Add garlic and onion, cook for 30 seconds. Add capsicum and cook for 1 minute. Transfer to the bowl with the beef.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1 1/2 tbsp oil. Add garlic and onion, cook for 30 seconds. Add capsicum and cook for 1 minute. Transfer to the bowl with the beef.

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1/3 cup Homemade Chinese Stir-fry Sauce, water and chili paste. Cook for 30 seconds or until sauce starts to thicken. Add green onion and snow peas, cook for 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1/3 cup Homemade Chinese Stir-fry Sauce, water and chili paste. Cook for 30 seconds or until sauce starts to thicken. Add green onion and snow peas, cook for 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Return beef and capsicum mixture to the wok, add noodles and stir fry for 1 minute 30 seconds, tossing to coat everything in the sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Return beef and capsicum mixture to the wok, add noodles and stir fry for 1 minute 30 seconds, tossing to coat everything in the sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, garnished with chili, sliced scallions/shallots and sesame seeds if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, garnished with chili, sliced scallions/shallots and sesame seeds if desired.

review.reviewBody:
I have made this several times and it is always perfect! And always eaten up right awayüòÉ
I have enjoyed making several of your recipes! Thank you!

Never commented on any website/blog before but I had to do it today! I made this noodle for family of 3 (me, hubby and 5yo daughter who is very fussy eater) and all of us really enjoyed tonight dinner (I did not put any hot chillies in it as my daughter can‚Äôt eat spicy food, even not a tiny bit of pepper). Will use this recipe in the future again and again. Thanks so much Nagi!

I made this noodle for family of 3 (me, hubby and 5yo daughter who is very fussy eater) and all of us really enjoyed tonight dinner and my daughter said it was delicious (I did not put any hot chillies in it as my daughter can‚Äôt eat spicy food, even not a tiny bit of pepper). I give this recipe 10 out of 10!
Your recipes are all gold Nagiüôè

Hi Nagi
Made this recipe tonight. It would have to be the best noodles I have made ‚ù§Ô∏è. I added a crushed clove of garlic when marinating and also chilli paste as I used chicken tenderloins. Also used the velveting method. Didn‚Äôt have serachi sauce so used sweet chilli sauce. Thanks so much for your beautiful recipe it was amazing
This was fantastic and hubby and I loved the flavor. Not enough spice though. We may add red pepper flakes to it. Thanks!
Delicious!! I swapped the beef for tofu and capo for broccoli and it was amazing. Thanks Nagi!

Tasted great but i found that if i made it at lunch for the family to eat at dinner time the hokkein didnt sit well, it felt thick. Im not familiar with hokkein noodles is this normal? It tasted great fresh off the pan but when i sat to have dinner with the fam it wasnt that nice. Any ideas?

Okay, I made this! AND WE LOVED IT! 
I used the beef velveting technique, I made the special sauce.. and cooked everything according to the recipe. Just swapped out veggies for ones we wanted. And I‚Äôve got to say, this is now a favourite in my household! Absolute winner!! Thank you sooo much for teaching me how to make delicious tender meat in stir fry‚Äôs!! Sooo life changing!

Easy and super delicious! 
Love your recipes! ‚ù§Ô∏è
